source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_SEQ_00<tab>Oboro has the look of a man who has seen better days.
target: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_SEQ_00<tab>船着場の平屋のオボロは、浮かない顔をしている。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_SEQ_01<tab>You find your old friend Oboro at something of a loss. News of his deeds on behalf of Princess Yuki have reached his village, revealing to the elders that he is hale, hearty, and entirely capable of making the journey home. Despite this, they do not seem particularly eager to welcome him back, a development which has the young shinobi feeling decidedly unappreciated. As Oboro laments his plight, he remembers that there is someone who requires his aid─Captain Jacke of the Rogues' Guild, who would investigate some shady Domans that have been stirring up trouble of late. Resolving to assist your friend and mentor in whatever way you can, you set out for Limsa.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_SEQ_01<tab>前回までの冒険録：
冒険者は、盗まれた家宝を取り戻すために、ひんがしの国から来たユキの手伝いをすることになった。他人を頼ろうとしないユキだったが、最後には冒険者に助けを求め、家宝を取り戻して国へ帰っていくのだった。
　　　　　　　　　　　　*　*　*
オボロは、里に嘘をついていたことがバレてしまったようだ。彼はジャックから協力を頼まれているという。リムサ・ロミンサの双剣士ギルドにいる「ジャック」と話そう。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_SEQ_02<tab>Jacke relates to you a curious tale. The Krakens captured a crew of self-styled Doman sailors in the eastern seas, who offered all the treasures in their cargo hold in exchange for amnesty and safe passage to Eorzea. No sooner had the ship dropped anchor, however, than the Easterners vanished into the dark of night, taking with them only an inconspicuous scroll. Petty theft though it may be, the code is the code, and Jacke would see the scroll returned and the men brought to justice. At the guildmaster's behest, you make for the Drowning Wench to see if I'tolwann knows aught of the men's whereabouts.
target: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_SEQ_02<tab>ジャックと話し、巻物を盗んだ東方人を探すことになった。リムサ・ロミンサの溺れた海豚亭にいる「イ・トルワン」と話そう。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_SEQ_03<tab>As I'tolwann tells it, a group of boisterous Easterners visited the Wench not long before, shouting loudly and conspicuously about a profitable transaction they intend to make in Wineport. Jacke will doubtless be eager to hear the news.
target: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_SEQ_03<tab>イ・トルワンと話し、東方人たちがワインポートへ向かったと聞いた。リムサ・ロミンサのブルワークホールにいる「ジャック」に報告しよう。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_SEQ_04<tab>Jacke listens to your report with great interest. Though more than a bit leery of how openly the men discussed their shady dealings, a lead is a lead. You set out for Wineport with Oboro and Jacke, taking care to watch your back and with your eyes and ears open.
target: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_SEQ_04<tab>ジャックに報告した。東ラノシアのワインポートへ向かった「ジャック」と合流しよう。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_SEQ_05<tab>Your arrival in Wineport is minutes too late─the men have already made off with a haul of wine, and were sighted heading for Bloodshore. Suspecting that it may not be meant for sale, but rather to slake a crew's thirst on a long ocean voyage, Jacke deduces that they intend to furtively sail back home with the ill-gotten scroll. Make for the south of Bloodshore and keep your eyes out for any suspicious Easterners.
target: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_SEQ_05<tab>ジャックと合流した。東方人たちは、ブラッドショアへ向かったようだ。東ラノシアのブラッドショア南で東方人を探そう。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_SEQ_06<tab>You come upon three Hingan swordsman enjoying some of Wineport's finest on the beach. Not taking kindly to the interruption, they immediately draw their blades. Though you are able to make short work of them, the scroll is nowhere to be found. Head north to rendezvous with Jacke and Oboro, with the hope that their search has proved more fruitful than your own.
target: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_SEQ_06<tab>東方人を見つけたところ、襲ってきたので討伐した。ブラッドショア北の「ジャック」と合流しよう。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_SEQ_07<tab>Jacke and Oboro are no worse for the wear after a similar scuffle with Hingan ruffians, but have gained no insight into the whereabouts of the scroll you seek. No sooner have you begun to ponder your next course of action when you are greeted by the sudden presence of the black marketeer from the House of Sticks, who─much to everyone's surprise─immediately reveals himself to be none other than Karasu Redbeak, Oboro's erstwhile friend and nemesis. As is his wont, Karasu speaks in riddles, cryptically alluding to a greater plot involving the scroll while offering precious little in the way of actual details─save that your true quarry sails for Kugane as you speak. Karasu disappears in a puff of smoke, and Oboro─clearly flustered─suggests that the three of you retreat to the nearby ninja hideout to discuss your next course of action in secret.
target: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_SEQ_07<tab>ジャックと合流したところ、カラスが現れて東方人はクガネへ向かったと聞いた。船着場の平屋へ向かった「オボロ」と話そう。

source:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_SEQ_08<tab>At the dock storehouse, you and your two companions come up with a plan. Jacke will sail ahead to Hingashi, with Oboro accompanying as a guide. In the meantime, you will train and hone your skills as a ninja, that you may be ready to answer the call when they need you. Bidding them a safe journey, you resolve to take your mastery of ninjutsu to new levels, as there is no telling what dangers await you across the Ruby Sea.

※The next ninja quest will be available from Yomei upon reaching level 63.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_SEQ_08<tab>オボロと話した。彼はジャックとクガネへ向かった。ヨウメイにオボロからの手紙が届くまで、技を磨いておこう。

※忍者のレベルが63以上になると、船着場の平屋のヨウメイから次の忍者クエストを受注することができます。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_TODO_00<tab>Speak with Jacke at the Rogues' Guild.
target: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_TODO_00<tab>双剣士ギルドのジャックと話す

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_TODO_01<tab>Speak with I'tolwann at the Drowning Wench.
target: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_TODO_01<tab>溺れた海豚亭のイ・トルワンと話す

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_TODO_02<tab>Speak with Jacke at Bulwark Hall.
target: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_TODO_02<tab>ブルワークホールのジャックに報告

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_TODO_03<tab>Rendezvous with Jacke in Wineport.
target: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_TODO_03<tab>ワインポートのジャックと合流

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_TODO_04<tab>Search for suspicious Easterners at Bloodshore.
target: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_TODO_04<tab>ブラッドショア南で東方人を探す

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_000<tab>Oh, alas and alack! Whatever am I to do...
target: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_000<tab>はぁ…………。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_001<tab>Oh, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>! As a shinobi, I am loath to admit this, but I did not see you come in.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_001<tab>ハッ、<var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>ではないか。
これはいかん、忍びともあろう者が、
こんなにも近くにいる、人の気配に気づかぬとは……。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_002<tab>Truth be told, I have been somewhat distracted of late. Princess Yuki, it would seem, sent a letter to my village praising us for our efforts on her behalf─thus revealing my story of an injury preventing me from making the journey home for the ruse that it was.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_002<tab>言い訳にはならぬが、少し気落ちしていてな。
というのも、ユキ姫が忍びの里に感謝状を送ったことで、
結局、私が怪我で動けぬ身体だという嘘は、バレてしまった。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_003<tab>But my shame is not that I have been summoned back to the village, but rather quite the opposite. Despite knowing that I am hale and hearty, my elders seem to be in no particular hurry to welcome me back into the fold.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_003<tab>すぐさま、里に連れ戻されると思いきや……。
長老からは、このままエオルゼアに留まるよう命じられたのだ。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_004<tab>“Should the time come when we have need for you in Doma, we shall summon for you. Until then, you are to remain at your post and do all in your power to aid our countrymen in Eorzea.” Such were their words.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_004<tab>ドマにて有事あれば、すぐに帰還せよ。
それまでは、この地のドマの民を支援するように……
というのが命令の趣旨だが、どうにも気持ちが浮かぬ。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_005<tab>Is this how far I have fallen? Am I as a falcon bereft of its claws? A dull blade tossed to the wayside by its master? For all I know, I have been all but exiled to this place.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_005<tab>いつまでも里に帰らなかったがため、
爪弾きにされてしまった気がしてならぬのだ。
もしかしたら、里にはもう私の居場所はないのかもしれない……。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_006<tab>I am sorry, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. Heaven knows that you did not come here to listen to my griping. On a brighter note, I just received word from Captain Jacke. It would seem some Easterners are causing something of a stir.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_006<tab>すまぬ……泣き言を聞かせてしまったな。
……ところで、双剣士ギルドのジャック殿から、
ドマの民に関する依頼が寄せられたらしく、協力を頼まれている。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_007<tab>I suppose I should be grateful that <var 1A 02 /var>someone<var 1A 01 /var> still has need of my services. Anyhow, it would seem the kami have led you here at a most opportune time. Would you care to accompany me?
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_007<tab>ちょうど、これから向かうところだったのだが、これも何かの縁。
よければ、<var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>も、手を貸してくれぬか？

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_008<tab>I thank you, my friend! Let us make for Limsa Lominsa and see what our friends at the Rogues' Guild would ask of us.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_008<tab>感謝する……それでは、双剣士ギルドへと向かい、
「ジャック」殿から話を聞こう。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_010<tab>I know not what my countrymen have done to catch Captain Jacke's eye, but I can only imagine it is nothing good...
target: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_010<tab>ドマの民に関する依頼とはいったい……？

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_YOUMEI_000_015<tab>
target: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_YOUMEI_000_015<tab>（★未使用／削除予定★）

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_020<tab>Well, if it ain't the dimberest damber of 'em all. I trust ye've been keepin' yer stabbers sharpened? What with you <var 1A 02 /var>and<var 1A 01 /var> Oboro on the job, I reckon all'll be bob afore the <var 08 E3E90C0D ((<var 08 E3E90C05 ((lightmans)) ((darkmans)) /var>)) ((<var 08 E3E90C12 ((darkmans)) ((lightmans)) /var>)) /var> comes 'round.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_020<tab>よう、<var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>、元気そうだな。
お前も手伝ってくれるんだって？
それなら、早期解決が期待できそうだ。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_021<tab>Here's where we stand: one o' me little birds in the Kraken's Arms came chirpin' to me a story 'bout some Domans who I reckon are breakin' one code or another.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_021<tab>ドマの民に関する依頼というのは、
リムサ・ロミンサ三大海賊の「百鬼夜行」からきたものだ。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_022<tab>Seems they─the Krakens, that is─were out snilchin' the eastern seas when they grabbled a vessel flyin' Garlean colors, as they're wont to do. But then came the rub─the crew claimed to be Doman, ye see, and upon whiddlin' their captors' identity, they changed tack, beggin' for asylum on Eorzean shores an' offerin' the entirety of their cargo in full in return for safe passage.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_022<tab>奴らの私掠船が、東方の海で一隻の帝国属州の船を拿捕した。
これがドマの船だったらしいのだが、相手が百鬼夜行だと知ると、
船員たちが、エオルゼアへの「亡命」を希望してきたという。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_023<tab>Call him a bene cove or a fool, the Kraken captain took the self-styled Domans up on their offer. Stowin' the Eastern treasures─an' the Easterners themselves─away in the hold, they set sail for Limsa.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_023<tab>そこで、百鬼夜行側はドマの民を自称する船員たちを連れ帰り、
積荷を船賃代わりに頂戴することにした。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_024<tab>But after pullin' into port, a funny thing happened. No sooner had the Krakens dropped anchor than the “refugees” put on their best beater cases an' skulked off into the dead of darkmans, leavin' all their treasures behind.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_024<tab>ところが、リムサ・ロミンサに到着するや、件のドマの民が、
積荷の中の「巻物」を盗んで、姿を消しちまったんだとさ。
巻物ひとつでも、略奪品が不当に奪われれば掟破りだ。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_025<tab>All their treasures save one─a scroll of sorts that had been hidin' in a corner, all inconspicuous-like. Carvallain reckons that these Doman “refugees” have played us for some rum fun, an' they're off sellin' the scroll on the black markets for good blunt even as we speak.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_025<tab>……というのが、頭領カルヴァランの主張だが、
実のところ、ほかにロクな積荷もなかったらしくてな。
その巻物こそが、値打ち物だったと判断したんだろう。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_026<tab>...I see. So you would have us recover the scroll in question and bring the thieving Domans to justice. I am honored to lend what aid I can, and yet, I cannot help but wonder. Just what could it be about this scroll to make it so valuable to my countrymen?
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_026<tab>……なるほど、その巻物の奪還が依頼の本筋か。
亡命を希望しながら、現地に到着するや逃げ出すとは妙だが、
その巻物というのも気になるところだな……。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_027<tab>Well, we're not goin' to whiddle the scrap just sittin' around here on our daddles, now are we? Let's snilch town and see what the common coves and morts have and haven't seen.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_027<tab>まずは、街に潜む双剣士たちから、
姿を消した、東方人たちの目撃情報を集めよう。
<var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>は、イ・トルワンをあたってくれ。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_028<tab><var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, why don't ye go pay I'tolwann a visit at the Wench? If there's any rumors goin' around about any shifty Easterners, like as not that mort would know.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_028<tab>まさか、忘れたわけじゃないよな？
溺れた海豚亭で給仕をしながら情報を集めている仲間だよ。
仕事中に酔うわけにいかないから、何を注文するかわかっているな？

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_029<tab>You <var 1A 02 /var>do<var 1A 01 /var> remember what to order, aye? 'Course a dimber damber like yourself would. Good luck out there, an' keep yer wattles open─we'll be waitin' for ye in Bulwark Hall when yer through.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_029<tab>それじゃ、俺たちはほかをあたる。
溺れた海豚亭の「イ・トルワン」は、お前に任せたぞ。
外へ出やすいように、この後はブルワークホールで落ち合おう。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_ITOLWANN_000_030<tab>Welcome to the Drowning Wench! What's your pleasure, <var 08 E905 ((miss)) ((sir)) /var>?
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_ITOLWANN_000_030<tab>いらっしゃいませ、溺れた海豚亭へようこそ！
ご注文は何になさいますか？

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_Q1_000_031<tab>What will you order?
target: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_Q1_000_031<tab>注文は……

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_A1_000_032<tab>A chilled ale.
target: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_A1_000_032<tab>冷えたエール

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_A2_000_033<tab>A strong ale.
target: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_A2_000_033<tab>強烈なエール

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_A3_000_034<tab>A weak ale.
target: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_A3_000_034<tab>薄めたエール

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_ITOLWANN_000_035<tab>Certainly, <var 08 E905 ((miss)) ((sir)) /var>. Take a seat, and I'll bring it straight to your─ Hm? Changed your mind?
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_ITOLWANN_000_035<tab>はい、かしこまりました。
席について、少々お待ちくださいね。
……あら、ご注文を変更するのですか？

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_ITOLWANN_000_036<tab>Ah, you must be here on business. Mayhaps I could offer you something from our <var 1A 02 /var>underground<var 1A 01 /var> menu. Now, what's your fancy?
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_ITOLWANN_000_036<tab>ふふ、久々に双剣士の仕事ですか？
……今回は何を聞きに？

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_ITOLWANN_000_037<tab>Guests from the <var 1A 02 /var>East<var 1A 01 /var>, you say? Why, yes, I do believe we had some visitors not long ago matching that description. They left shortly before you arrived.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_ITOLWANN_000_037<tab>……東方人の目撃情報ですか。
それなら、少し前に見慣れぬ東方風の男たちが、
この酒場に集まって、何やら相談をしていましたよ。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_ITOLWANN_000_038<tab>I make a habit of pricking my ears up to catch our patrons' every whisper, but the party in question required little such effort. Why, they were shouting of tales of riches and glory in a roar that could wake the dead!
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_ITOLWANN_000_038<tab>いつも、お客の話には聞き耳を立てていますが、
そうするまでもなく、彼らは酒場に響き渡る大声で話していました。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_ITOLWANN_000_039<tab>Said they were on their way to Wineport to make the transaction of a lifetime─though they weren't keen on going into detail. Just between us, I wouldn't be surprised if there was something less than <var 1A 02 /var>savory<var 1A 01 /var> about their business. Speaking of savory, can I interest you in our seafood stew?
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_ITOLWANN_000_039<tab>なんでも、ワインを買い込みたいらしくて、
ワインポートへ向かうことに話がまとまり、去っていきましたよ。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_ITOLWANN_000_045<tab>The party of Easterners said they were en route to Wineport. I'd be wary if you plan on following them─they seemed to be a rather <var 1A 02 /var>unsavory<var 1A 01 /var> lot.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_ITOLWANN_000_045<tab>見慣れぬ東方人たちは、ワインを買い込みたいらしく、
ワインポートへ向かうことに話がまとまり、去っていきましたよ。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_046<tab>I wish you an <var 1A 02 /var>ahoy<var 1A 01 /var> and an <var 1A 02 /var>avast<var 1A 01 /var>, my honored matey! Ah, forgive me─I was just practicing my Lominsan dialect. How do you─er, <var 1A 02 /var>ye<var 1A 01 /var>─reckon it sounds?
target: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_046<tab>住民に紛れて潜むとは、双剣士も忍びと同じでござるな。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_050<tab>So our lads are headed to Wineport, eh? Bene work, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. Remind me to slip I'tolwann some extra blunt next time we stop by the Wench for libations.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_050<tab>……そうか、こちらも東方風の者たちが、
ワインポートへ向かったという情報を掴んだ。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_051<tab>That said, somethin' doesn't sit right with me. Cacklin' their plans for every drunkard and tavern wench to hear? I reckon our friends might be lookin' to amuse us, if you whiddle my gist. Keep your eyes open and your stabbers sharp, mates.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_051<tab>こうも簡単に行方を掴めてしまうのが、どうも気になるが……
ともかく、「ワインポート」へ向かうとしよう。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_055<tab>I am sorry, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. I fear we were too late...
target: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_055<tab>残念ながら、一足遅かったようでござる……。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_060<tab>Well, there's a bleedin' surprise. The code-breakin' curs have already bit the blow and hopped the twig, with a caravan's worth of bingo in tow. Word is they were last seen beatin' a path for Bloodshore.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_060<tab>どうやら、一足違いだったようだ。
東方風の者たちが、ワインをたらふく買って、
ブラッドショアの方へ向かったところだと聞いた。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_061<tab>But what could they mean to─wait a bleedin' moment! What if the grog's not meant for sellin', but keepin' their throats wet on a long voyage? I reckon our lads are tryin' to smuggle the scroll home.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_061<tab>待てよ……酒は水代わりとなる航海の必需品だ。
もしかしたら、奴らは船でどこかへ逃げる気かもしれない！

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_062<tab>There's no time to lose! Let's brush off our beater cases an' make for Bloodshore all quick-like. Oboro an' I'll snilch the north side─<var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, you take the south. We have to catch these curs afore they slip from our daddles for good!
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_062<tab>急いで、「ブラッドショア」の浜辺へ向かい東方人を探そう！
浜辺は広いから、二手に分かれた方がよさそうだな。
俺たちは北へ向かう、<var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>は南を頼む！

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_DOMANPEOPLE02948_000_070<tab>Heh... You just had to poke your nose in our business, eh? Guess you leave us no choice...
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_DOMANPEOPLE02948_000_070<tab>あぁん……追手か？
だったら……殺せって命令だ！

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_POPMESSAGE_100_071<tab>The Hingan swordsmen draw their blades and attack!
target: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_POPMESSAGE_100_071<tab>敵が襲いかかってきた！！

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_075<tab>This garb... Why, these men are samurai from Hingashi! Whatever is the meaning of this?
target: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_075<tab>この者たちは、東方の侍のようだが……いったい、何者？

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_080<tab>Let me guess. Ye came upon a couple of rough-lookin' coves. These coves came wavin' their stabbers in my face afore I could edge in a word─I reckon 'twas the same for you?
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_080<tab>こいつら、急に襲いかかってきやがったんだが、
そっちも同じだったのか……。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_081<tab>The scroll is nowhere to be seen, nor is anything resembling a ship. If I did not know better, I would say they were a simple group of ruffians enjoying their ill-gotten grog.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_081<tab>……巻物が見当たらない。
それに、船で逃げようとしていたとは思えぬ。
ただ酒盛りをしていただけに見えるが……。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_KARASU_000_082<tab>(-???-)The dim one sees, but does he truly <var 1A 02 /var>see<var 1A 01 /var>? No─these unfortunate men were but pawns in a grand scheme, as disposable as the bottles that now litter the shore.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_KARASU_000_082<tab>(-？？？？-)そいつらは、追跡者を引き付けるためのただの捨て駒。
本命は、エールポートに向かったよ。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_KARASU_000_083<tab>Meanwhile, your <var 1A 02 /var>true<var 1A 01 /var> quarry has boarded a trader and sails for Kugane even as we speak, under the auspices of the East Aldenard Trading Company, no less! So cunning a scheme, I wish I'd thought of it myself─or <var 1A 02 /var>did<var 1A 01 /var> I? Ahahaha!
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_KARASU_000_083<tab>そして、遠洋航海に出るためエールの買付に来ていた、
東アルデナード商会の交易船に乗って、見事にトンズラさ。
ひんがしの国の港街「クガネ」に向かったようだね……ウププ。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_084<tab>How do ye know all─bugger me, yer the cove from the House o' Sticks!
target: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_084<tab>お前は、流れの闇商人……なんでこんなところに？

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_085<tab>Karasu Redbeak!?
target: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_085<tab>え……お前、カラスじゃないか！

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_KARASU_000_086<tab>Childhood friends turned bitter enemies, then friends once more─reunited after far too long! Our hero returns, and the audience swoons! O, what a joyous day─or <var 1A 02 /var>is<var 1A 01 /var> it?
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_KARASU_000_086<tab>はいはぁ～い、こんにちわぁ～ん！
みなさん、お久しぶりィ～。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_KARASU_000_087<tab>I'll say this much, dim one: for once, you've managed to surprise me. To think that the oh-so-serious Oboro would lie to his elders to avoid having to make the journey home─only to find he wasn't welcome to begin with! Oh, the irony of it all!
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_KARASU_000_087<tab>オボロくんは、相変わらず優等生って言いたいところだけど……。
帰りたくないからって、里に嘘つくなんてさァ、
キミも変わったもんだよネェ～。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_088<tab>Enough of your preening and prattling, Karasu! I want answers. How did you know we were here? Just what is your connection to the thieves we pursue?
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_088<tab>黙れ、黙れ！
そんなことより、なぜ、お前が奴らのことを知っているのだ？

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_KARASU_000_089<tab>Ahahaha! You mean the thieves who already eluded your clumsy grasp─just as I am about to do? I fear <var 1A 02 /var>that<var 1A 01 /var> is a story for another day!
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_KARASU_000_089<tab>プププ、さぁ～て、どうしてだろうネェ～？
……それじゃぁまたね、あっは～ん。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_090<tab>Bah! Ever the slippery bird, that one.
target: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_090<tab>……クソッ、相変わらず逃げ足の速い奴だ。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_091<tab>That daft rook's an acquaintance of yours? That's news to Jacke's wattles. Meanwhile, we've got our work cut out for us if we still want to grabble that scroll. Is there anywhere we can have a few whids─ye know, secret-like?
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_091<tab>あの情報通が、お前らの知り合いだったとはね……。
それにしても、まんまと犯人を取り逃がしちまったようだな。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_092<tab>Say no more, Captain Jacke. As luck would have it, our base of operations is but a short walk from these parts. <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, pray join us at the storehouse.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_092<tab>ここは我らの隠れ家「船着場の平屋」が近い。
とりあえず、そこで、今後のことを決めようではないか。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_095<tab>I reckon this is about the shabbiest, shoddiest shack ol' Jacke's ever laid eyes on─in other whids, the perfect hideout. Aye, Oboro's sharper than he lets on.
target: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_095<tab>へぇ、隠れ家としては悪くないが……ちょっと地味だな。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_100<tab>Karasu Redbeak... Of all the places I thought our search might lead us, never in my wildest dreams did I think it would lead us to <var 1A 02 /var>him<var 1A 01 /var>!
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_100<tab>まさか、カラスが現れるとはな。
しかし、わざわざ情報を伝えにくるとは……
もしや、我々に協力してくれるということか……？

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_101<tab>Come square with me, Oboro. Just who is this Karasu cove? Can we trust him, or is he like as not to stick us his stabbers in our back the moment we turn a blind eye?
target: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_101<tab>オボロ、そのカラスって奴は仲間なのか……？

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_102<tab>N-No! I mean, yes! I mean he's neither─or both? Perhaps I should say...it's complicated.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_102<tab>ま、まさか！
そんなことはない、奴はいつか私が討つべき宿敵だ！

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_103<tab>Judgin' from yer reaction, it sure seems as much. Anyway, if our men have set sail for Hingashi, I reckon we've no choice but to do the same. I wasn't exactly preparin' for a long voyage, but damned if I'll leave this job half-done.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_103<tab>そのわりには嬉しそうだったがな……。
さて、「ひんがしの国」とはまた遠いが、
俺は引き受けた仕事は最後までやり遂げる性分なんだ。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_104<tab>That said, 'shamed as I am to admit it, this is ol' Jacke's first journey to the Far East─I wouldn't know Kugane from a rum doxy's arse, and I don't know a rogue what can do his work without knowin' the lay of the land.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_104<tab>だが、さすがに東方は俺にとっても未知の領域。
オボロ、お前なら「クガネ」ってところも知ってるんだろ？
俺と一緒に、その街へ向かって仕事を続行してくれねぇか？

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_105<tab>Worry not, Captain Jacke! I have traveled there on many an occasion to procure the tools of my trade from the finest Hingan artisans. It would be my pleasure to serve as your guide.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_105<tab>もちろん、そのつもりでござる。
クガネなら、忍具の取引で何度も行っている。
それでは、私たちは彼の地へと向かうことにしよう。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_106<tab>Your presence would be most heartening as well, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. Kugane is a city where anything can happen, and there is no telling what dangers await us there.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_106<tab>向こうで何か進展があったら、<var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>にも、
是非とも協力してもらいたい。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_107<tab>I'll agree with that─but mind ye, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>'s a right busy <var 08 E905 ((mort)) ((cove)) /var>. What say we do it this way? Oboro an' I will go on ahead, an' we'll send for you once we've snilched out the place and worked out our next plan of action.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_JACKE_000_107<tab>すまねぇが、俺からも頼むぜ。
腕利きは多い方が助かるってもんだ。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_108<tab>A reasonable plan, Captain Jacke. In that case, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, pray check in at the storehouse from time to time. I will send word to Yomei when we require your services. In the meantime, may the kami guide you in your training!
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_OBORO_000_108<tab>協力の必要が生じたときには、「ヨウメイ」宛に文を出そう。
折を見て、彼の下を訪ねてみてくれ。
それでは、次はひんがしの国のクガネで会おう！

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_SYSTEM_000_110<tab>The next ninja quest will be available from Yomei upon reaching level 63.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_SYSTEM_000_110<tab>「忍者」の新たなジョブクエストが開始されました。
次のクエストは「レベル63」以上で、
船着場の平屋のヨウメイから受注可能です。

source: TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_SYSTEM_000_111<tab>The requirements for undertaking subsequent quests can be reviewed in your journal.
target:
TEXT_JOBNIN601_02948_SYSTEM_000_111<tab>今後の「忍者」のジョブクエスト受注条件は、
コンプリート後のジャーナルで確認できます。
